name: heterotopic self #I
description:
I see myself in the mirror where I am not, I see myself in an unreal space that opens up virtually beyond the surface, I am there, where I am not. A kind of shadow that gives me my own visibility and allows me to look at myself where I am not: mirror utopia. But to the extent that I really exist and have a kind of return effect where I am, the mirror is also heterotopia; the mirror is also a heterotopia, insofar as I see myself there, to the extent that I have a flashback effect where I am; I discover from the mirror that I am not where I am, as I see myself there. At the bottom of this virtual space, which is on the other side of the mirror, in a sense, due to this look directed at me, I return to myself and begin to direct my eyes towards myself and to form again where I find myself; The mirror functions like a heterotopia in the sense that it makes this place I occupy the moment I look in the mirror both absolutely real and absolutely unreal.

-Michel Foucault
